title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message:
BKL_PWM - 1.47V
BKL_EN - 2.84V
LCDBKLT - 8.57V

BKL_PWM - 1.47V is OK??

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message:
There is pulse width modulation (PWM) signal, not pure DC voltage.
Voltmeter in DC range will make an integration of that signal and show some kind of medium value; depending of the duty cycle.
Check resistance to ground on both pins of D7701.
Liquid signs on that area?

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message: do a PRAM reset and also check feedback trace....

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message:
Of course I dont have short on D7701 as LCDBKLT - 8.57V = PPBUS means -> No short
I did PRAM reset
No liquide damge board.

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message: PWM seems too low. Remove R7704 and connect pin 3 directly to 3V somewhere and see if BKL works at full brightness. If not the LP8550 is suspect

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message:
PWM now is 3.2V and also replaced LP8550 and still no backlight.

Compared with another board isen4, isen5, isen6 are 0L to ground in diode mode, so I miss these 3 RETURNS.
Is that enought to miss backlight?

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message: That could only happen if R7720-22 are bad or the trace. Most likely is a badly soldered LP8550 of course.

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message: Was badly soldered. Missing only one return will cause the same? No backlight?

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message: So it was bad soldering, does it work now?

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message: Yes, now it works. Was bad LP8550. They just die this way?

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 missing backlight
message: Anything can die. It works now, so done.
